section.title: Overview
section.para: Hedwig is an open source IMAP, SMTP server written in Java, designed with ease of installation and configuration in mind. Hedwig enables storage of mail message headers in a relational database and mail messages in a file system. Currently MySQL can be used as storage backend.

listitem.para: 100% pure Java capable of running on Java 1.5 onwards.
A normal MTA (Currently Postfix) can be used for accepting messages. The MTA hands the messages using a pipe interface. LMTP (Local Mail Transport Protocol) support is in progress.
Supports multiple commonly used IMAP extensions, including CHILDREN, I18NLEVEL=1, NAMESPACE and QUOTA.
Hedwig requires the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) version 1.5 or higher installed on the target platform for the basic runtime operation.
The Java Software Development Kit (JDK) Version 1.5 or higher is needed to build the sources.
Hedwig depends upon a working installation of MySQL.
More IMAP extensions, including ACL, SEARCHRES, SORT and THREAD.
